senselogic.sitevision.api.user

Interface UserIdentityWrapper

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Wrapper<Node>

    public interface UserIdentityWrapper
extends Wrapper<Node>
    User identity wrapper interface.

    This wrapper provides methods to check and update the social network (i.e. contacts and collaboration groups) of a (wrapped) user identity.

    Note that a disabled user identity is prohibited to execute some of the mutating/write operations.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via UserFactory.getUserIdentityWrapper(javax.jcr.Node). See UserFactory for how to obtain an instance of the UserFactory interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 3.6
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Detail

      • getContacts

        Set<Node> getContacts()
        Gets the contacts of the wrapped user identity.
        Returns:
        the contacts of the wrapped user identity. Never null.

      • isContact

        boolean isContact(Node aUserIdentity)
        Checks if the wrapped user identity is contact with a specified user identity.
        Parameters:
        aUserIdentity - the user identity to check
        Returns:
        true if aUserIdentity is a contact of the wrapped user identity, false otherwise

      • addContact

        boolean addContact(Node aUserIdentity)
        Adds a contact for the wrapped user identity.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To be allowed to add a contact for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_USER_IDENTITIES on current page.

        Parameters:
        aUserIdentity - the user identity (or user) that should be added as contact for the wrapped user identity
        Returns:
        true if aUserIdentity was added as contact for the wrapped user identity, false otherwise

      • removeContact

        boolean removeContact(Node aUserIdentity)
        Removes a contact of the wrapped user identity.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To be allowed to remove a contact for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_USER_IDENTITIES on current page.

        Parameters:
        aUserIdentity - the user identity (or user) that should be added as contact for the wrapped user identity
        Returns:
        true if aUserIdentity was added as contact for the wrapped user identity, false otherwise

      • getCollaborationGroups

        Set<Node> getCollaborationGroups()
        Gets the collaboration groups of the wrapped user identity.

        Permission note! The returned set will only contain the collaboration groups that that current user is allowed to read (i.e. PermissionUtil.Permission.READ).

        Returns:
        the accessible collaboration groups of the wrapped user identity. Never null.

      • isAdminOf

        boolean isAdminOf(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        Checks if wrapped user identity is admin of a collaboration group.
        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to check
        Returns:
        true if the wrapped user identity is admin of aCollaborationGroup, false otherwise

      • isMemberOf

        boolean isMemberOf(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        Checks if wrapped user identity is member of a collaboration group.
        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to check
        Returns:
        true if the wrapped user identity is member of aCollaborationGroup, false otherwise

      • leaveGroup

        boolean leaveGroup(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity leaves a collaboration group.

        Only members can leave a collaboration group, i.e. the leave attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity isn't a member of specified collaboration group. Note that a group admin is also a group member so leaving a collaboration group might in fact also remove an admin, but last admin will never be removed. Collaboration groups that are inactive can not be leaved.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To remove group membership for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to leave
        Returns:
        true if the leave operation succeeded, false otherwise

      • joinGroup

        boolean joinGroup(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity joins a collaboration group.

        Only non-members can join a collaboration group, i.e. the join attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity already are a member of specified collaboration group. Collaboration groups that are inactive can not be joined.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To join a collaboration group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to join
        Returns:
        true if the join operation succeeded, false otherwise

      • followGroup

        boolean followGroup(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity follows/eavesdrops a collaboration group.

        Only non-members can follow a collaboration group, i.e. the follow attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity already are a member of specified collaboration group. Collaboration groups that are inactive or closed can not be followed.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To follow a collaboration group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to follow
        Returns:
        true if the follow operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.1

      • getFollowedGroups

        Set<Node> getFollowedGroups()
        Gets the collaboration groups the wrapped user identity follows/eavesdrops.

        Permission note! The returned set will only contain active collaboration groups that that current user is allowed to read (i.e. PermissionUtil.Permission.READ).

        Returns:
        the accessible collaboration groups the wrapped user identity follows. Never null.
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.1

      • isFollowing

        boolean isFollowing(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        Checks if wrapped user identity is following/eavesdropping a collaboration group.
        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to check
        Returns:
        true if the wrapped user identity is following aCollaborationGroup, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.1

      • unfollowGroup

        boolean unfollowGroup(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity stops following/eavesdropping a collaboration group.

        Only followers can stop following a collaboration group, i.e. the unfollow attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity isn't a follower of specified collaboration group. Collaboration groups that are inactive can not be unfollowed.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To unfollow a group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to stop following
        Returns:
        true if the unfollow operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.1

      • muteGroup

        boolean muteGroup(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity mutes a collaboration group (entries will not show up user's in compound timeline).

        Only members can mute a collaboration group, i.e. the mute attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity is not a member of the specified collaboration group.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To mute a collaboration group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to mute
        Returns:
        true if the mute operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1
        See Also:
        muteNotifications(Node)

      • unmuteGroup

        boolean unmuteGroup(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity unmutes a collaboration group.

        Only members can unmute a collaboration group, i.e. the unmute attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity is not a member of the specified collaboration group.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To unmute a group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to unmute
        Returns:
        true if the unmute operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1

      • isGroupMuted

        boolean isGroupMuted(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        Checks if wrapped user identity has muted the collaboration group.
        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to check
        Returns:
        true if the wrapped user identity has muted aCollaborationGroup, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1

      • muteNotifications

        boolean muteNotifications(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity mutes notifications from a collaboration group (entries will show up but not notifications).

        Only members can mute notifications from a collaboration group, i.e. the mute attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity is not a member of the specified collaboration group.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To mute notifications from a collaboration group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to mute notifications from
        Returns:
        true if the mute notifications operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1
        See Also:
        muteGroup(Node)

      • unmuteNotifications

        boolean unmuteNotifications(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        The wrapped user identity unmutes notifications from a collaboration group.

        Only members can unmute notifications from a collaboration group, i.e. the unmute attempt will be ignored if wrapped user identity is not a member of the specified collaboration group.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To unmute notifications from a group for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_COLLABORATION_GROUP and PermissionUtil.Permission.READ on the collaboration group.

        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to unmute notifications from
        Returns:
        true if the unmute notifications operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1

      • isNotificationsMuted

        boolean isNotificationsMuted(Node aCollaborationGroup)
        Checks if wrapped user identity mutes notifications from the collaboration group.
        Parameters:
        aCollaborationGroup - the collaboration group (or collaboration group page) to check
        Returns:
        true if the wrapped user identity mutes notifications from aCollaborationGroup, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 9.1

      • getProfileImage

        Node getProfileImage()
        Gets the profile image of the wrapped user identity.

        Note! This method returns the 'raw' profile image (i.e. a node of type sv:image) that the user has uploaded. For buddy icons, see BuddyIconRenderer.

        Returns:
        the profile image or null
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.0

      • getProfileImagesFolder

        Node getProfileImagesFolder()
        Gets the profile images folder of the wrapped user identity.
        Returns:
        the profile images folder or null
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.2

      • setProfileImage

        boolean setProfileImage(Node aProfileImage)
        Sets the profile image of the wrapped user identity.

        This method sets the active profile image, i.e. determines which profile image that should be used. To create a new profile image (i.e. new binary data), you would typically use a method in ImageUtil first.

        Model note! A profile image must be a node of type sv:image and a child of the profile images folder of the wrapped user identity. The profile images folder is available via getProfileImagesFolder().

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To set the profile image for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_USER_IDENTITIES on current page.

        Parameters:
        aProfileImage - the profile image
        Returns:
        true if the set operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.2

      • setHidden

        boolean setHidden(boolean aHidden)
        Sets the visibility of the wrapped user identity in search results.

        Permission note! This mutating operation is not allowed for a wrapped user identity that is disabled. To update the hidden property for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_USER_IDENTITIES on current page.

        Parameters:
        aHidden - true if the wrapped user identity should be hidden, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if the set operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.2

      • setDisabled

        boolean setDisabled(boolean aDisabled)
        Sets the availability of the wrapped user identity.

        Permission note! To update the disabled property for the wrapped user identity, current user must match the wrapped user identity (i.e. "is yourself") - or have PermissionUtil.Permission.MANAGE_USER_IDENTITIES on current page.

        Parameters:
        aDisabled - true if the wrapped user identity should be disabled, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if the set operation succeeded, false otherwise
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.3

      • isDisabled

        boolean isDisabled()
        Checks if the wrapped user identity is disabled or not.

        This is a convenience method the check the boolean value of the disabled property of the wrapped user identity. Note that a disabled user identity is not allowed to perform any mutating/write operations except setDisabled(boolean).

        Returns:
        true if the wrapped user identity is disabled, false if not
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.3

      • getUserIdentity

        Node getUserIdentity()
        Gets the wrapped user identity.

        Note! This method is equivalent with Wrapper.unwrap() if this wrapper is created with a sv:userIdentity node.

        Returns:
        the wrapped user identity
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.3

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
